title: epi2me-labs/wf-basecalling
description: Helper workflow for signal processing and primary data analysis of Oxford Nanopore Technologies' reads.

input.title: Input Options
input.description: Parameters for finding and handling input data for analysis.

input.title: Input directory
input.description: Directory containing FAST5 (or POD5) signal for basecalling.
input.help_text: This directory will be searched recursively. All FAST5 or POD5 files (depending on which extension you select in the Basecalling Options) in this directory or any subdirectory (no matter how deep) will be basecalled.

ref.title: Reference FASTA file
ref.description: Optional reference FASTA file to align basecalled reads to.
ref.help_text: Without a reference, basecalls are output to unaligned CRAM. When using a reference, take care to retain this FASTA file as the output CRAM file cannot be read without the reference it was aligned to.

output.title: Output Options
output.description: Parameters for saving and naming workflow outputs.

out_dir.title: Output directory
out_dir.description: Directory for output of all files.

sample_name.description: Sample name to prefix file names of workflow outputs.

fastq_only.title: Output FASTQ not CRAM
fastq_only.description: Output unaligned FASTQ instead of unaligned CRAM.
fastq_only.help_text: FASTQ can only be output when a reference has not been provided. Aligned output will always be written to CRAM even if fastq_only is set.

output_bam.title: Output BAM not CRAM
output_bam.description: Output unaligned BAM instead of unaligned CRAM.
output_bam.help_text: Some downstream applications do not yet support CRAM and will require a BAM file. Enabling this option will output BAM instead of CRAM. You should only use this option if you know that it is needed. Output files will be larger than the corresponding CRAM files that would have been written if this option was not enabled.

basecalling_options.title: Basecalling options
basecalling_options.help_text: This section contains options that should be checked before basecalling.

basecaller_cfg.title: Basecaller configuration
basecaller_cfg.description: Name of the model to use for converting signal.
basecaller_cfg.help_text: Required for basecalling. The model list only shows models that are compatible with this workflow.

duplex.title: Duplex calling
duplex.description: Run the basecaller in duplex mode.
duplex.help_text: By default the workflow conducts simplex basecalling. If you used a chemistry and flowcell combination that supports duplex reads, you may switch this option on. This option is incompatible with the watch_path option due to the way the input files must be traversed in order to find duplex pairs.

remora_cfg.title: Modified basecalling model configuration
remora_cfg.description: Name of the model to use for calling modified bases.
remora_cfg.help_text: Required for calling modified bases while basecalling. The model list only shows models that are compatible with this workflow.

dorado_ext.title: Input file format
dorado_ext.help_text: Set this to fast5 if you have not converted your fast5 to pod5. It is recommended to [convert existing fast5 files to pod5 for use with Dorado](https://github.com/nanoporetech/pod5-file-format/blob/master/python/README.md#pod5-convert-from-fast5).

poly_a_config.title: Poly(A) config toml file
poly_a_config.description: Provide this TOML file to turn on and configure dorado poly(A) calling.
poly_a_config.help_text: This TOML file allows you to turn on and configure poly(A) tail calling options in dorado. This feature is described [here](https://github.com/nanoporetech/dorado?tab=readme-ov-file#polya-tail-estimation).

barcode_kit.title: Sequencing kit name
barcode_kit.description: Name of the kit to use for barcoding. Demultiplex the data.
barcode_kit.help_text: Providing a kit here will instruct the workflow to demultiplex your 'pass' data to BAM files which can be found in your output dir under the folder 'demuxed' in a struture reminissent of MinKNOW.

advanced_basecalling_options.title: Advanced basecalling options
advanced_basecalling_options.help_text: These basecalling options do not typically need to be changed.

output_pod5.title: Output converted FAST5
output_pod5.description: Save the converted POD5 when running in duplex with FAST5 inputs.
output_pod5.help_text: Dorado duplex only supports POD5 input. The workflow will automatically convert FAST5 input to POD5 when duplex calling. By default, converted POD5 are deleted to save disk space. Enabling this option will make the workflow output converted POD5 files to a subfolder within the output directory.

qscore_filter.description: Mean qscore by which to filter reads. Inclusive such that reads with score >= qscore_filter are kept.
qscore_filter.help_text: The mean qscore of reads is calculated by dorado and rounded to an integer by dorado and stored as a tag in dorado's SAM output. The pipeline separates reads into pass and fail categories based on this SAM tag.

basecaller_chunk_size.description: Number of input files to basecall in each basecalling process.

basecaller_model_path.description: Override the named basecalling model with a custom basecalling model.
basecaller_model_path.help_text: For typical use, users should set --basecaller_cfg which will use a named model from inside the container. Experimental or custom basecallers will not be available in the container and can be loaded from the host with --basecaller_model_path.

remora_model_path.description: Override the named remora model with a custom remora model.
remora_model_path.help_text: For typical use, users should set --remora_cfg which will use a named model from inside the container. Experimental or custom models will not be available in the container and can be loaded from the host with --remora_model_path.

basecaller_basemod_threads.description: Number of threads to use for base modification calling.
basecaller_basemod_threads.help_text: You must set this to > 0 when using a modbase aware model. Modbase calling does not require much additional CPU and should be set carefully when using GPU servers with a small number of CPUs per GPU.

basecaller_args.description: Additional command line arguments to pass to the basecaller process.

demux_args.description: Additional command line arguments to pass to the basecaller barcoding process.

use_bonito.description: Use bonito rather than dorado for basecalling. Highly experimental, many options will not work when this is enabled.
use_bonito.help_text: This experimental option is not recommended for normal use and is not supported.

bonito_cfg.title: Basecaller configuration
bonito_cfg.description: Name of the model to use for converting signal.
bonito_cfg.help_text: Required for basecalling. The model list only shows models that are compatible with this workflow.

multiprocessing_options.title: Multiprocessing Options
multiprocessing_options.description: Advanced options for configuring the performance of specific workflow processes.
multiprocessing_options.help_text: These options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

ubam_map_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for aligning reads from uBAM (limited by config executor cpus)

ubam_sort_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for sorting and indexing aligned reads from uBAM (limited by config executor cpus)

ubam_bam2fq_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for uncompressing uBAM and generating FASTQ for alignment (limited by config executor cpus)

merge_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for merging BAM files (limited by config executor cpus)

stats_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for getting stats from output files. (limited by config executor cpus)
